arts.ttl: Ireland vs Portugal – Official lineups: Vitinha and Neves in the starting lineup
arts.sum: As part of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers, Portugal will be at the Aviva Stadium this Thursday (kick-off at 8:45 pm, CET) to face Denmark. Three Paris Saint-Germain players are involved in this match, all on the Portuguese side: Vitinha (25-year-old midfielder), João Neves (21-year-old midfielder), and Gonçalo Ramos (24-year-old striker). arts.ttl: Ireland vs Portugal live stream: Where and how to watch the match?
arts.sum: Portugal faces Denmark in a live stream on L’Equipe Live Foot this Thursday at 8:45 PM for the 2026 World Cup qualifiers at the Aviva Stadium. arts.ttl: Cristiano Ronaldo bizarrely calls for Ireland fans to BOO him as Portugal superstar expects hostile reception in Dublin
